properties.name: The White House
properties.description: The official residence and workplace of the President of the United States since 1800.
properties.funFact: The White House has 132 rooms, 35 bathrooms, and 6 levels!

properties.name: U.S. Capitol
properties.description: The iconic dome of American democracy, home to the U.S. Congress.
properties.funFact: The Capitol's dome weighs 8.9 million pounds and stands 288 feet tall!

properties.name: Lincoln Memorial
properties.description: A tribute to President Abraham Lincoln with his iconic seated statue.
properties.funFact: Lincoln's statue is 19 feet tall and weighs 175 tons!

properties.name: Washington Monument
properties.description: The world's tallest stone structure and obelisk, honoring George Washington.
properties.funFact: At 555 feet, it was the world's tallest structure from 1884 to 1889!

properties.name: Jefferson Memorial
properties.description: A neoclassical memorial dedicated to Thomas Jefferson, the third U.S. President.
properties.funFact: The memorial's bronze statue of Jefferson weighs 5 tons!

properties.name: National Mall
properties.description: The heart of monumental Washington, a 2-mile green space lined with museums.
properties.funFact: Over 24 million people visit the National Mall each year!

properties.name: Smithsonian Castle
properties.description: The iconic red sandstone building and home to the Smithsonian Institution.
properties.funFact: The Castle contains the crypt of James Smithson, the institution's founder!

properties.name: Supreme Court
properties.description: The highest court in the United States, with its iconic marble columns.
properties.funFact: The inscription 'Equal Justice Under Law' is above the main entrance!

properties.name: Library of Congress
properties.description: The world's largest library with over 170 million items in its collection.
properties.funFact: The library adds 12,000 items to its collection every working day!

properties.name: Arlington National Cemetery
properties.description: A military cemetery honoring those who served the United States.
properties.funFact: Over 400,000 service members and their families are buried here!
